scenario:
Schlumberger (SLB) stock fell 24% in 2024 despite year-over-year beats in revenue and earnings, due to record drilling in the US suppressing oil prices. Analysts forecast 7.6% earnings growth in the next 12 months and a consensus price target of $58.25, a 51% increase from its current level. SLB offers a 2.86% dividend yield with a three-year average annualized growth rate of 4.5%.

United Parcel Service (UPS) stock has been in a three-year slump, delivering a negative total return of 34.67% to investors. However, the company reported a year-over-year beat on the top and bottom lines in its third-quarter earnings report. Analysts have a Moderate Buy rating on UPS stock with a consensus price target of $151.10, giving investors approximately 22% upside and supported by projections for earnings growth of 16% in the next 12 months.

Lockheed Martin (LMT) stock fell over 20% in the last three months of 2024 due to concerns over the company's valuation and potential defense spending cuts. However, the company has a $166 billion order backlog and forecasts sales of $71.25 billion for its fiscal year 2024. Analysts give LMT stock a Moderate Buy rating with a consensus price target of $605.36, along with a 2.74% dividend yield that has been increasing for 22 consecutive years.
